Question: Which of the following sentences uses the correct punctuation?
Options: My dog loves to play fetch, run and bark.
My dog loves to play fetch run and bark!
My dog loves to play fetch, run, and bark.
My dog loves to play fetch; run and bark.
answer: My dog loves to play fetch, run, and bark.
Rationale: This sentence correctly uses commas to separate items in a list, and includes the Oxford comma (the comma before 'and'). This makes the sentence clear and grammatically correct.
